Name: Printer Matter
Description: Largest store dedicated to zines I've come across in NYC.

Name: Hauser & Wirth
Description: The W 18th St location has a bar, gallery space, and bookstore with a curated selection ranging from mainstream bestsellers to more niche publications.

Name: The Drama Book Shop
Description: Theater and film-focused bookstore that stocks play scripts as well. Not exactly my cup of tea but bring your thespian friends here.

Name: Rizzoli Bookstore
Description: They have a myriad of photobooks and frequent author talks.

Name: Mercer Street Books & Records
Description: Compact shop filled with used books at affordable prices. I was able to find some good titles in my favorite genres.

Name: Fishs Eddy
Description: All sorts of funky kitchenware can be found - some more affordable than others. Fishs Eddy also has unique NYC-themed items that would make for great souvenir gifts.

Name: Gothic Renaissance
Description: Came here because my friend was looking for medieval-inspired outfits (I may be mixing my time periods together) but their clothing is super cool to look at.

Name: Bungee Space
Description: Lots of underground publications and Chinese zines. Also large selection of streetwear clothes in the back. Many things to stop and look at inside.

Name: Mighty Lucky
Description: I laughed when I first walked inside because it's literally a concept store of someone's favorite things. They sell plants, tabletop art pieces, and is also a legal cannabis dispensary.

Name: Philip Williams Posters
Description: Vintage posters and prints ranging from postcard-sized to full-wall hangings.

Name: Pageant Print Shop
Description: I stumbled across this place by accident and was pleasantly suprised by their large selection of nature and map-themed prints.

Name: Archie's Press
Description: Unique prints and posters - you'll find a lot of their stuff at various flea and craft markets.

Name: Toy Tokyo
Description: Tightly-packed with blind boxes and anime trinkets.

Name: Sweet Pickle Books
Description: Exchange your books for pickles!

Name: Mociun Fine Jewelry & Home Goods
Description: Very interesting home decor pieces ... in particular they seem to specialize in realistic-looking food pieces.

Name: ACRE
Description: It's a food hall in the back but a tiny little shop in the front selling Japanese ceramic goods and kitchenware.

Name: Souvenir
Description: Classic modern tchotchkes shop. Great for finding specific gifts for specific friends.

Name: Tula House
Description: Beautiful plant store with gorgeous interior.

Name: Million Goods
Description: Wine bar, music, and clothing - another brainchild of someone's favorite things. If I were a man I'd buy all the clothes here for my wardrobe.

Name: Yoseka Stationery
Description: Japanese stationary store.

Name: Wilcoxson Brooklyn Ceramics
Description: Pricey but spunky ceramic cups and bowls.

Name: Word
Description: Bookstore.

Name: Lockwood Greenpoint
Description: I got a green skirt I really liked from here. Gift shop with clothing, NYC-themed trinkets, and toys.

Name: Secret Riso Club
Description: One-of-a-kind zines and prints. I really want to attend one of their risograph workshops.

Name: Hive Mind Bookstore
Description: Coffee shop + bookstore combo; large selection of queer and feminist literature.

Name: Honey Moon Coffee Shop
Description: Coffee shop + bookstore combo.

Name: Lichen
Description: Furniture and interior design store.

Name: Left Field NYC
Description: Men's workwear - I got a cool t-shirt from here.

Name: Topos Bookstore Cafe
Description: Coffee shop + bookstore combo.

Name: Saint Seneca Store
Description: Minimalist concept store.

Name: usagi
Description: Art gallery + cafe + bookstore. When I went they were displaying artwork from a famous anime illustrator.

Name: Outside Space Garden Center
Description: I randomly wandered here out of curiosity and found a lovely garden as a respite from the busy city streets. It's a plant nursery.

Name: Greenlight Bookstore
Description: Bookstore.

Name: BLOK HAUS
Description: Plants.

Name: Remix Market NYC
Description: Thrift store for furniture and home decor.

Name: Astoria Bookshop
Description: Bookstore.

Name: Scorpion Records
Description: Record Store.

Name: East Broadway Mall
Description: Go to the second floor to find all the alternative thrift stores for trust fund babies.

Name: FGS Outpost
Description: I only popped in for a quick second but my interpretation is that it's a minimalist concept shop.

Name: Yu & Me Books
Description: Bookstore.

Name: Bluestockings Cooperative Bookstore
Description: Bookstore. Very progressive selection of books.
